title: Augusta County: Samuel Franklin Carson to Annie Harris, February 6, 1863
summary: Carson complains about the weather but says that he is happy that the roads are closed, meaning that the army won't be moving. This means that more of the men get furloughs, though he does not expect to return home until the war's end. He includes some gossip.
keywords: Camp Life, Desertion/Leave, Family, Home Front, Military Authority, American Civil War
